Name: A New Companion
QuestDesc: After the battle of Norfall Barren, everything came to an end. Your friends are calling you for a meet-up with snacks at Panhua's Restaurant. It seems they like to know more about that "little one" from within your body...

Chapters.Title: Head to Panhua's Restaurant and talk to your friends

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over here! Been waiting for ya!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought Yangyang said you had a super cool lil' buddy to show us. Where is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, I don't know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did it just... pop out of your Tacet Mark...?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm... smells good!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... Is this how it first showed up when you guys were in the Norfall Barrens?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, back then, we...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I fought off those Tacet Discords, a burst of energy erupted from that statue...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Two forces clashed and collided, and later one of them emerged victorious, vanquishing the other in a violent clash.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: General Jiyan and Rover later told me it was this little thing coming out of Rover's body. It was blocking, or even "consuming" the overflow of Threnodian power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It reminded me of how Rover once absorbed frequency energy with {Male=his;Female=her} body in a similar fashion. So we took {Male=him;Female=her} to the Academy for a check-up with Baizhi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apparently... this little one is what we had detected before. It’s the speculated "Space" or "Organism" hidden inside your body. Now we finally know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It shares similar frequencies with Tacet Discords' Reverberations. It resembles an Echo processed by the Data Bank, stored inside your body instead of a Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In other words, it's your own Echo, captured or absorbed at some point. Without you, it can't manifest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why Baizhi couldn't confirm just how you absorbed that Echo back then. Was it you? Was it the little one? Or maybe, the two of you together?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Baizhi discovered more after analyzing your spectrums.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She found a new power source within you, similar to the Crownless but even stronger. This power comes from the Tacet Discord you defeated in Norfall Barrens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, the excess energy this little thing had "consumed" somehow ended up in your body, available at your disposal. In other words, there's a deeper connection between the two of you. Or, according to Baizhi, it’s a Convergent Codependency.

Options.PlotLineKey: Convergent Codependency?
That's new. What does that mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, to put it simply... you are connected. While you are two separate individuals, your energies and vitals can affect each other, for better or for worse. You may even feel each other's emotions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The bond between you and this creature is symbiotic. As it strengthens, so do you. However, if one is harmed, the other suffers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fortunately, since it can't ever leave your side, it's not an easy target for attackers. And if they do strike, it can seek shelter inside your body for safety.

Options.PlotLineKey: I... think I understand.
Sounds complicated. Let's talk about it later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, now that's... pretty much it. Baizhi was going to explain it to you herself, but she has to go check on a newly appeared Sonoro Sphere in Zhaozhou...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, wait! This is too much information for me to process! Let me get this straight. So, it helped Rover fight off the Threnodian?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seriously? This teeny tiny thing could do that? Hmm. Seems unlikely...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Outside Panhua's restaurant, the creature within you, drawn by the food's aroma, emerges from your Tacet Mark. Baizhi's tests reveal that the Threnodian energy it absorbed has completely fused with you, forming a mysterious symbiosis, or Convergent Codependency.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph! Don't look down on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll regret it when you learn what I'm capable of!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That poker-faced researcher was absolutely shocked when she examined me! Said I'm not just any Echo, I'm a super duper cool one. Rarest of them all! Heh heh!

Options.PlotLineKey: You sure you didn't add anything extra?
That doesn't sound like the Baizhi I know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, no way Baizhi talks like that. She's more of a data dump kind of person. "Super duper cool"? Nah, too extra for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like you're trying to boost your ego a bit!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, actually... While those aren't Baizhi's exact words, that is what she meant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She mentioned highly intelligent Echoes that can act on their own in other countries. Said they are involved in every aspect of human life, with unique abilities beyond our imagination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those Echoes are rare though. Neither I nor Baizhi, an Ecoacoustics expert, have ever seen one in person. But this little thing here… It could be one of those foreign Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, makes sense! Now we just gotta figure out where it came from. Who knows, we may find other cool Echoes in that place!

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you seriously buying all of this already?
Sure, sounds doable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, both General Jiyan and Baizhi have confirmed it. No way they're lying.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll admit, the thought of someone else having an Echo inside them sounds pretty crazy to me. But with you, anything's possible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can absorb Reverberations with just your hands, like the legend says. So maybe one day you just stumbled upon this little thing and soaked it up like a sponge. Sounds feasible, I guess?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sooo...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know where exactly {Male=he;Female=she} absorbed you?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? How am I supposed to know... Why don't you just ask {Male=him;Female=her}?

Options.PlotLineKey: Because they know I don't remember.
Sure, she can ask. It's not like I have the answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. It happened before {Male=he;Female=she} lost all memories, so we have to ask you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk tsk... Don't take that tone with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... even if Echoes can have memories, they probably wouldn’t remember things earlier than their first manifestation. I wonder if that's the case with this little one, too?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha, finally someone with common sense.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That green-haired serious guy asked me a similar question. Sorry to disappoint, but I really don't remember anything before I showed up.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm. Maybe... maybe I was just sleeping inside {Male=him;Female=her} this whole time, so of course I don't remember!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sleeping? Seriously? It's been so long! All those happenings, all that fighting, and you didn't hear anything? Well that's... Your sleeping quality is really something.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'd prefer it to NOT stay awake all the time.
Uh, please no. There are things I don't want it to hear...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, so you've got privacy to be respected.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry! Your body's sound insulation is amazing. Dive into it and everything goes quiet.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The only problem is, I never know when I'll wake up again. And when I do wake up, I get tired, hungry fast, so I have to crawl back in for more rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I know! It's all because I'm not eating enough!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why you kept disappearing. You went back to sleep from lack of energy. Makes sense. Regular Echoes need to be powered by the Terminal too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, I thought you'd be really different from the usual ones we see. Turns out you share a lot in common.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you probably don't know your denomination, or a nick name? No wonder everyone's been calling you the "little one"...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Denomination? What's that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The universally agreed terms for special Echoes, like names for humans. They are named based on their characteristics, abilities, and places of origin.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My denomination... It's... It's... I don't know. Do I not have a name at all?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No way! Nooo way! That's not fair! If all the special Echoes have names, how can I not have one?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't wanna be called the "little one" all the time. It doesn't sound cool at all!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about this: you help me come up with a name, and I will let you have some of the food...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's nothing left...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This small, rare Echo has no memory of its origins or the events in the Norfall Barrens. Intrigued by the concept of names, it asks you to bestow one upon it, having forgotten its own.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Erm... Next time! Next time I'll definitely save some for you! Just... give me a name! Please!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A name? Now?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I want it now! Look, your name's Chixia, your name's Yangyang, and you... Uhhh, your name is...

Options.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? ...That sounds interesting. Wait, didn't you forget everything? How do you still remember...

Options.PlotLineKey: I just came up with it. It's my new name now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With your old name and memories all gone, it's a good idea to go with a new one. It makes everything more convenient and represents a fresh start.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, exactly like she said! Every one of you has a name, and I want one for myself too! Really not asking much.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just want a name that sounds a little cool, a little special and epic and super smokin'!

Options.PlotLineKey: That's a long list of descriptors...
Yeah, you having a name should make things easier.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Names are a big deal, you know? Like, once you have one, it's stuck with you for life. Gotta make sure it's a good one!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't have people not scared of me when they hear it. No time for regrets here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see... You want a cool one... What about "Echo the Invincible"? What do you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nah, nuh-uh, absolutely no! That's too straightforward. It's-It's no better than calling me the "little one"!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, it makes every difference in the world! "I am Echo the Invincible!" That's what a Hero Play character would say as their transformation call!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe... Since you can fly and you've got those long ears... why don’t you call yourself... "Righteous Raptor"? Or "Valor Hawk"? "Flying Fury"?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, absolutely no. Why do they all sound so... cringy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? I love it when people call me the Jinzhou Speedster. Doesn't that sound awesome?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... Haha, sure, if you say so... Anyway, they all sound like anything but my name. ABSOLUTELY NO!

Options.PlotLineKey: Absolutely no this, absolutely no that. What do you want?
Let’s make it simple. Why don't you just call yourself Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha! I knew {PlayerName} would come up with a good... Wait. Why does it sound so random?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You didn't just pick two random syllables, did you?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why not? Simplicity works wonders.
Abby means joy. It's what you bring to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I mean... Yeah, it's simple, easy to remember. l can imagine myself yelling it out loud, and at least it sounds better than Chixia’s cringy titles... But you know, it doesn’t feel quite majestic enough...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... Is it because I've been saying "Absolutely no" a lot...?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Why, isn't that a nice name..)
(Maybe I should come up with a better one...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Hmm... Why is it suddenly so quiet? Is it not happy with the name? Why though... Can't think of anything better that's catchy, impactful, and clever all at once.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Uh, I meant to tease it as a joke, but I can tell it's upset now. On second thought, a name is indeed very important. Maybe I'll have to come up with a different one...)

Options.PlotLineKey: Let’s just think of another...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Abby... Abra... Abraxas?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's wrong? What are you muttering about? Abra... what? Sounds like you're reading a spell.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Erm, I don't know, but... I just have this feeling that... this is what my name should be. Okay, ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby! I like the sound of that. That's my name!

Options.PlotLineKey: I thought you didn't like it.
Good. Saves us time thinking of another one.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course I like it! You came up with it for me! I was just... trying to get used to it, that's all! Besides, I feel attached to this name now.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little One"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My name is Abby. You will NOT call me the "little one" again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, we won't. Got it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that didn't work out. I was hoping we could get some answers from the little... I mean, from Abby, but now we're back at square one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I really thought we could figure out where Abby came from. It might not lead us to other special Echoes, but it's at least a starting point to uncover {PlayerName}'s past. Then we'll have something to do before asking Madam Magistrate and our Sentinel about it again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe we can start with Abby's special abilities instead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Each special Echo has a unique ability. We can compare what Abby does with our records of other Echoes to see where they came from. Besides… It was Abby’s power that helped {PlayerName} defeat the Threnodian, I suppose?

Options.PlotLineKey: Likely so.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do you sound so unsure? Didn't you see it all with your own eyes?

Options.PlotLineKey: It happened too fast. I didn't get a clear look.
I'd be more sure if I can see it again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… Abby, can you show us again? I'm super curious how you did that. Who knows, we might learn something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, since you asked, I'll show you how it's done! But... this place is too crowded. Let's move to that open spot over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The little one rejects Chixia's grandiose names, prompting you to suggest "Abby." To your surprise, it loves the name, saying it sounds just right. Curious about Abby's origins, you ask it to demonstrate its abilities hoping to learn something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright. Ahem! All eyes on me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-what's going on? I... I'll try again! Just you see!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... What? Did something happen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: J-Just a little slip, that's all! I can do it! You gotta trust me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, I just stood in front of {Male=him;Female=her}, and that big bad Threnodian monster thing just... just... left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... you didn't really do anything?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? No, I... I definitely did something!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like I said, I was asleep, and then all of a sudden, I smelled something really yummy coming closer and closer… It was like nothing I ever smelled before!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't have time to think. I just had to show up and reach out for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... maybe Abby's power activates automatically under certain circumstances? Perhaps Abby can’t control it yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, it looks that way. You can't even hold your shape for very long yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, hey! Stop looking down on me! Like I said, it was just a little slip, really!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But think about it! I just stood there and did nothing and ended up beating a THRENODIAN! Imagine what I could do if I actually tried!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}! Get behind me next time we run into anything, 'kay? I'll keep you safe, promise!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're so real for that, Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You bet! I said I'm super strong. I'll protect {Male=him;Female=her}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's very reassuring to hear. But... it seems we're stuck again. I can't think of anything else to check out.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let’s take our time. There's no hurry.
We'll still need to figure out my past first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Knew it. Nothing about {PlayerName}'s ever gonna be easy to figure out... Hmm. Maybe we should bring Baizhi, Mr. Xiangli Yao, and all the researchers in Jinzhou... No, in the entire Huanglong together. They'll do a nice and thorough examination on Abby, and then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ABSOLUTELY NO!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I said NO! Told that poker-face researcher already!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll make it clear. I am to stay with {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I agree. Abby cannot leave {PlayerName}'s side, but we can't just trap {Male=him;Female=her} here for research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where did you absorb Abby, what are Abby's powers, and what exactly happened between you two... There are so many questions we can't figure out yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our Sentinel Jué can look into the future. Nothing ever deviates from its predictions. It has already sort of guided you to the Norfall Barrens through Madam Magistrate's messages, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that the Threnodian crisis is over, perhaps you can consult our Magistrate and our Sentinel again. I’m sure they can offer you some more useful guidance.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll pay Jinhsi another visit once she returns.
We'll have to wait for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Relax, relax! You have me now, remember? Meeting up with that Jinhsi person? Getting your memories back? I've got you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of that, so this Sentinel can predict the future? That sounds cool. The name "Jué" sounds pretty cool too. It's almost as cool as mine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What does it look like? Where is it? Since we're paying it a visit, this Sentinel should treat us with food, right? I wonder how the food's gonna taste...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our Sentinel protects every one of us. Of course it's cool!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... why are you talking about food again. Didn't you just stuff your face? What? Is your stomach a black hole?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't help it. I'm always starving…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After parting ways with Yangyang and Chixia, you travel around Jinzhou with Abby while waiting for replies from Jinhsi, trying to look for more clues about your past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Several days later...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby tries and fails to showcase its abilities. Maybe it has yet to learn how to activate its power. The answers may lie within your lost memories. Perhaps you can uncover hints during your meeting with the Magistrate and Sentinel Jué.
